data.title: A good place for fried fish
data.text: This is not the place to go for gourmet seafood and great ambiance. This is really the place to go for fried seafood that tastes good, is not too greasy, and where you get a good value for your hard earned dollar. They have great daily specials. I prefer the cod loins basket, while my wife has been favoring the Basa fingers. The fries are consistently some of the best in town. The serving staff is friendly, attentive (usually) and helpful. The place is very clean and well maintained. If you call for take out and they say it will be ready in ten minutes, you can count on it. They have a reasonable selection of beers available, but keep in mind this is a restaurant, not a bar or brew pub. This is my go to place for good seafood, fast and fairly priced.

data.title: Very good fish
data.text: Love this place! Great food and good prices. Clean and very friendly and courteous staff. Fish and chips are fantastic!

data.title: Disappointed
data.text: Went here several Fridays in a row and decided the fish quality wasn't that good and the fries were mediocre at best.  Quit going.

data.title: Not what it used to be
data.text: Smaller fish and less fries. Last year this place was awesome. We brought many visitors here. My trip this time, not good. Pollock fish was dark and very strong. Serving size of my cod was much smaller.

data.title: Great cheap eats!!
data.text: Love Shark's.  Local eatery for fish and chips any which way you want 'em.  Generous portions, tasty, fresh and plain old good food!!  We visit often.

data.title: Friendly, Fast, Fare, Fair
data.text:
Tried Shark's Fish House tonight (9/15/16)  as we had been running all day preparing to settle on a house in a local North Port community.  We've been in the area since Tuesday, so we've had burger and chicken, salad, but no fish.  Reading the reviews made us hungry for fish and we wanted to stay close to our motel as we are up early in the morning for final walk thru and settlement.  The restaurant is small, clean, and has three full walls of windows so there are only a few decorations.  We both had fish. My husband had the All-You-Can-Eat fish fry, but could eat only one serving- 4 long pieces, fries, and slaw. Wait, I ate his slaw.  He left one little piece of fish that was the end and was just a tad thinner than the rest of the fish.  He enjoyed his meal, although he said, it wasn't as good as a restaurant at the Delaware beach where we also have a home.  I had the same fish (pollock), but only one piece with four coconut shrimp.  I also enjoyed the fish and I liked the shrimp, but another restaurant (that Australian place) has coconut shrimp and dip that I like better.  I also had a cup of the New England Clam chowder.  The soup was good, thick, but not enough clams in my serving.  We also had a basket of hush puppies.  They were good, just a faint touch of onion, but I do like the sweet ones better.    I was not disappointed in the fries, super hot-fresh out of the fryer, not too thin, not to thick and if they were seasoned it was just a touch which was fine for me.  However, my husband  wanted some Old Bay Seasoning for his fries and fish, we'll bring some next time. No desert this time...no room.
The server was friendly and attentive.  She checked with us a couple of times to see if my husband wanted more fish and if all was okay. She kept our drinks filled and gave me one for the road.  There wasn't any line, but people kept coming in so it started to fill up quickly.  We will visit again.  
Service was very good and food was served hot, was good, and reasonably priced.

data.title: Delicious shrimp!!
data.text: Really love the food here. Great service, nice staff. Love the coconut shrimp. We have eaten here many times, food is always good!!

data.title: Good Fish Dinner at a Good Price
data.text: No frills restaurant but very good fish dinners. Not a lot of seating so plan ahead during snow bird season. They are very good at substitutions if you are watching your diet or have special diet needs. Standard dinner is fried fish, fries, and coleslaw, but I had sautéed fish, rice, and coleslaw.

data.title: friendly fish place
data.text: I enjoy this simple little place. The workers are always friendly and helpful. You get plenty of food for the money. Coleslaw is good, fries are good and fish and shrimp is always cooked perfectly.

data.title: Ok Place, if you like everything fried.
data.text:
From the outside, passing by in the car, it looks appealing. It looks like a nice place' so my fiancé and I decide to go have dinner there one night. We looked up their menu, seemed really good, wide selection, prices were really low, so we gave it a try. 
Well, we went on a Monday night and there were like 4 people in there. The place looks like a cheap version of someone's basement with checkered table clothes, a roll of paper towels on the table. This was faster than fast food, quality wise. Everything was fried! I mean everything. This place could do really well if they just stepped it up a notch or three. I told my fiancé maybe we should go to McDonald's after this.....sorry just not a place I would ever return to.

data.title: Best everyday fish house in the area !
data.text: If you and the family just want a nice meal without all the frills and pomp, this is the restaurant for you. Several different selections and combinations of fish, shrimp , clam cakes and strips make up the bulk of their menu. The restaurant is clean, the atmosphere is casual and you will be treated like family. The fish choices suit almost everyone and are served hot and delicious. The prices are casual as well with different daily specials that are easy on the wallet.

data.title: Warmest smile ever, wholesome flavours
data.text: On entering you are welcomed with a warm smile and seated exceedinly Fast. Service was five star, attentive and informative. Warmest smile ever. Freshest fish at its finest. We had blackened fish which is a chilly seasoning. The fish was cooked to perfection and the fish was most certainly the hero of the dish. This fish had been cooked with respect. The amazing waitress gave us a complimentary piece of haddock to try so we would know for our next visit, HOW COOL is that. Everything was perfect. Five star service with five star fish. I highly recommend a visit.

data.title: Causal dining. Fsh of all kinds.
data.text: Large portions of mostly fried fish.  Fish and chips very good. Crispy but not dripping iwth grease. Fish not served with bread. so cant make a sandwhich. Gets crowded dudring winter season. Good hush puppies.  Tables available and lits of carry out service.

data.title: Great eat-in food and nice and clean!
data.text: I like my food and atmosphere clean. The food is very nice, hand made, not alot of pre-prepared food. They make and mix things on-site, and quality and taste shines. Our whole table ordered the fish and chips, and everyone ate every bit of food. I'm vegetarian and I even had a nice salad here,  not spectacular, but fresh, it actually had green lettuce instead of just iceberg. The staff was extremely accomodating, as we sat and caught up with friends, and planned a trip together. We were not rushed and left a nice tip for their kindness. GIVE THEM A TRY!

data.title: Ole time favorite
data.text: This little restaurant stole my heart. The food and service is really good. It's a fun place for family and friends to gather for a nice fish and chips. The services is fast, no reservations needed.

data.title: Love this Place
data.text:
We live local to this restaurant, and they have the best haddock I've ever eaten. We try to eat here once every few months. I always get the haddock.

I've tried to the crab cakes one time, but didn't like them. They had to much breading in them, and not enough crab meat. I prefer to fix my own crab cakes at home.

The price is good, and portions are large. The people that work here are courteous and make you feel like a part of the family.

data.title: Fish
data.text: We have to get our "fish fix" once a week and go to Shark's for it! We love the atmosphere with the friendly workers and the owner..Great cod!!

data.title: ok, I'm sold
data.text: I reviewed Sharks a month ago after a not so great take-out.  So to be fair I visited for lunch and dined in.  What a difference.  The food was delicious in all respects.  Since then I have eaten at Sharks twice  and both times my meal was excellent.  I highly recommend the cod basket, and the fried shrimp.  I must concede that I was totally wrong in my initial assessment, and I am a total convert to Sharks...do go and eat some great seafood at SUPER prices..get a nice table and enjoy...you will be pleasantly surprised. ...

data.title: A small intimate fish house.
data.text: family run restaraunt speciallizzing in fish and seafood.  Servings are great and the prices are moderate.  Closed on Sunday and Monday.

data.title: Best fish n chips in town!
data.text: Can't beat the price and the fish and chips are delicious! The limited parking is the only downside.
